intro: Decarydendron ranomafanensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically have five petals. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
